title: Alipore (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Alipore (Vidhan Sabha constituency) was an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="South%2024%20Parganas%20district">South 24 Parganas district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>.
Overview.
As a consequence of the orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, Alipore (Vidhan Sabha constituency) ceases to exist from 2011.
It was part of <a href="Kolkata%20Dakshin%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Kolkata Dakshin (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>,
Around half of the electorate of the constituency were slum dwellers.
Election results.
2009 Bye-election.
A bye-election was held on 10 November 2009 following the resignation of the sitting <a href="Member%20of%20the%20Legislative%20Assembly%20%28India%29">MLA</a>, <a href="Tapas%20Paul">Tapas Paul</a> who was elected as <a href="Member%20of%20Parliament">MP</a> In Parliament from <a href="Krishnanagar%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Krishnanagar (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>. Firhad Hakim of Trinamool Congress Defeated Kaustav Chatterjee of CPIM.
2006.
In the 2006 election, <a href="Tapas%20Paul">Tapas Paul</a> of Trinamool Congress defeated his nearest rival <a href="Biplab%20Chatterjee">Biplab Chatterjee</a> of CPI(M).
 
1977-2009.
In the 2009 by-election, <a href="Bobby%20Hakim">Firhad Hakim (Bobby)</a> of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a> won the 148 Alipore assembly seat. The by-election was necessitated by the election of sitting MLA, <a href="Tapas%20Paul">Tapas Paul</a>, to the Lok Sabha from the <a href="Krishnanagar%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Krishnanagar (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>. In <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006</a> and 2001 elections to the state assembly, Tapas Paul of Trinamool Congress won the seat defeating his nearest rivals <a href="Biplab%20Chatterjee">Biplab Chatterjee</a> and Mira Bhowmick respectively, both of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI(M)</a>. <a href="Saugata%20Roy">Saugata Roy</a> of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> defeated Rathindranath Roy Choudhury of CPI(M) in 1996, Tarhin Roy Choudhury of CPI(M) in 1991, and Ashoke Bose of CPI(M) in 1987. Anup Kumar Chandra of Congress defeated Ashok Kumar Bose of CPI(M) in 1982. Ashoke Kumar Bose of CPI(M) defeated Salai Baran Chatterjee of <a href="Janata%20Party">Janata Party</a> in 1977.
1951-1972.
Kanailal Sarkar of Congress won in 1972 and 1971. Mani Sanyal of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India">CPI</a> won in 1969 and 1967. Somnath Lahiri of CPI won in <a href="1962%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1962</a> and <a href="1957%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">1957</a>. In <a href="1952%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">independent India’s first election in 1951</a>, Satendra Kumar Basu of Congress won the Alipur seat.
